com.fxgraph.graph

Class NodeGestures

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fxgraph.graph.NodeGestures

  • public class NodeGestures
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles interaction with graph nodes, so far only including mouse dragging for translation.

    Note that CellGestures uses the same mouse button for enabling resize handles.
    Author:
    sirolf2009, ogallagher (javadoc)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  NodeGestures.DragContext
      Stores x,y anchor/start point information for a graph node drag in progress.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javafx.scene.input.MouseButton dragButton
      The mouse button to use for dragging graph nodes.
      private NodeGestures.DragContext dragContext
      While a drag is happening (the mouse button has not yet been released), the drag context keeps track of the drag offset from the drag start point.
      private Graph graph
      The graph to which interactive graph nodes belong.
      private javafx.scene.Node lastTransparentNode
      If the mouse button for viewport panning is used to start a drag over a graph node, that graph node's interactivity is disabled until that drag is complete.
      (package private) javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMouseDraggedEventHandler
      Handle the endpoint of an incomplete node drag.
      (package private) javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMousePressedEventHandler
      Handle the start point of a new drag.

    • Field Detail

      • dragContext

        private final NodeGestures.DragContext dragContext
        While a drag is happening (the mouse button has not yet been released), the drag context keeps track of the drag offset from the drag start point.

      • graph

        private final Graph graph
        The graph to which interactive graph nodes belong.

      • dragButton

        private javafx.scene.input.MouseButton dragButton
        The mouse button to use for dragging graph nodes.

      • lastTransparentNode

        private javafx.scene.Node lastTransparentNode
        If the mouse button for viewport panning is used to start a drag over a graph node, that graph node's interactivity is disabled until that drag is complete.

        TODO [ogallagher] It seems preferable to prioritize moving the node if the node drag button is the same as the viewport drag button.

      • onMousePressedEventHandler

        final javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMousePressedEventHandler
        Handle the start point of a new drag.

        Note that if the viewport drag button conflicts with the node drag button, only the node will be dragged.

      • onMouseDraggedEventHandler

        final javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMouseDraggedEventHandler
        Handle the endpoint of an incomplete node drag.

      • revertLastNodeTransparency

        public void revertLastNodeTransparency()
        Convenience method for setNodeMouseTransparency(lastTransparentNode, false).

      • setNodeMouseTransparency

        private void setNodeMouseTransparency(javafx.scene.Node node,
                                      boolean value)
        Enable or disable (transparent) interactive gestures on a node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to change.
        value - Whether the node is transparent (not interactive).
